meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was an eyesore in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti-covered wall was considered an eyesore by the residents.
meanings.sent3: The bright pink house stood out like an eyesore among the other homes.
meanings.sent4: The cluttered desk was an eyesore, a visual cacophony of papers and pens.
meanings.sent5: The rusty car in the yard was such an eyesore that it became a local landmark.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is very unattractive or unpleasant to look at.
meanings.sent1: The old factory was an eyesore in the otherwise beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent2: The broken statue in the park was an eyesore for visitors.
meanings.sent3: The bright orange socks were an eyesore with his formal suit.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned shopping cart in the river was an eyesore to the environmentalists.
meanings.sent5: The cracked window on the historic building was an eyesore that needed immediate attention.
